Internal attributional style is when an individual attributes the cause of a behavioral, physical or mental characteristic to themselves. External attributional style is when an individual attributes the cause of an event to something external such as another person's actions, the environment, or circumstances. The transferred post changes the attribution style from internal to external by focusing on external factors such as temporary forms of self-expression rather than blaming oneself for not being able to help others in a particular way.
